Microblog/mastodon is now mirrored at oddevan.tumblr.com
🎵 Gonna ask this again, like I do almost every year: anyone know any good new wave/retro wave/synthpop/EDM Christmas music?
The Mythbusters said that lying down and resting is 90% as good as actual sleep. The day after restarting Vyvanse post-vacation, I desperately need that to be true.
🎵 Okay, what’re the songs that, if you let them, will absolutely make you cry? For me, it’s

“Walk On” / U2
“Dare You To Move” / Switchfoot
“Happy Is a Yuppie Word” / Switchfoot
“Christmas Don’t Be Late” / Rosie Thomas
…among others.
Via @WhollySchmidt

content.content: Huge if true!

I tend to frequent a local coffee shop for waffles. Today’s soundtrack as I walked in was “I’m Still Standing,” “Funky Town” as I waited, and “Take On Me” as I left.
This bodes well for today.
So... sometimes the only way to win is not to play.

- @oddevan@micro.blog / status.eph.me
- paperairplanemob.tumblr.com
Social media is just blogging by another name. We're building a better one at smolblog.com.

I’m a web developer. I have, if I’m honest, some pretty good skills in that area. And that tends to give me some unhealthy internal motivation. (I can DIY, therefore I should.)
Feels good to let that go, TBH.
Posted from status.eph.me 😎

link.title: eevee ☢️ on Twitter
link.pullQuote: at that point it will be impossible to start over, because two thirds of the web will be seo spam with machine generated prose underneath machine generated hero images.  and then machine learning will be dead
link.pullQuoteCaption: eevee ☢️ on October 3, 2022

content.content: IIRC this is one reason why Google shut off their website translation API: they were training it on translated websites, but eventually all the multilingual websites were using their translations. Instead of learning, it became self-reinforcing.
Because January 6 was a wake-up call. And the current GOP is doing everything they can to make sure nothing comes of it.
So if you want me to believe that the GOP is more than Carlson and Trump and MT-G and Cruz, give me something to believe in.
Please.
My country needs you.
Where is the line?
At what point is it “too much”?
What has to happen for you to vote against them? (Not just abstaining, not just a “principled” 3rd party vote, but actually throwing weight behind their biggest opponents.)
I’ll admit, I’m pretty fatalistic. While I never actually joined the GOP. I usually identified with them until the mid-2010s. It’s easier for me to write something off rather than try to change it.
But I have to ask my neighbors who do still identify as Republican:
And there is literally no one with any authority in the GOP speaking against it.
I remember when John McCain pushed back against Birthers at his own rallys, saying that Obama was indeed an American (though with fundamental political differences, of course).
Where is that now?
We have elected officials saying that Democrats are literally killing Republicans.
We have a state legislature deliberately flouting its state’s Supreme Court’s orders about election districts.
This is so much more than the usual politics of saying one thing and doing another.

Neighbors, things are already bad. The Republican Party in the United States has no leaders in the party or candidates running for office that say the 2020 election was a fee and fair election. They reject any norms, rules, and (at this point) even laws that keep them from power.

link.title: Thomas Zimmer on Twitter
link.pullQuote: You don’t have to know anything about history to understand that a situation in which the whole spectrum on the Right is united against democracy while everyone else is still debating whether or not the anti-democratic threat is really *that* bad is very, very dangerous.
link.pullQuoteCaption: Thomas Zimmer on September 30, 2022

content.content: Been thinking about this a lot this week.
Had a Twitter convo a few days back where a mutual said the Right would be tempted to align with opportunists. I said it was already happening.
He just said it would get worse.
I let it go when others got involved, but…
Character A: But you’re in a hive mind! How can you play Mario Kart if they know everything you’re going to do?
Character B: Oh, that isn’t going to help them, since I know everything they’re going to do.
A: Huh.
B: Yeah. Strange, isn’t it?
End Scene
pic.twitter.com/8vF7xkilrT

Me: finishing a plugin interface for @_smolblog and ready to start codifying a value type abstraction.
My freezer: hey so I’ve had my door open for a bit.
Me: …how long?
F: long enough for stuff to melt.
Me: and you didn’t tell me because?
F: the door wasn’t open enough
Today’s morning find: Get any installed Composer packages of a particular type.
So if you were to require a package of type, say, smolblog-plugin, the system could pick it up and include it automatically.
